  • Plotting

Plotting#

This list provides information for plotting results.

Analyses the quality of the Monte Carlo Simulation by computing the standard deviations

plots.analysis.analysis(conf)[source]#

Analysis of a MC simulation by plotting the standard deviations

Parameters:

  • config (dict) – Configurations

  • -save (str, optional) – Additional save path. Default ‘./’.

  • -add (str, optional) – Additional text in filenames.

  • -T – Compare temperature in K

  • -B – Compare magentic field strength in Gauss

  • -vlos – Compare line of sight velocity in cm/s

  • -inc – Compare inclination by subtracting in deg

  • -azi – Compare azimuth by adding in deg

  • -title ([str]) – Title of the 4 figures plot

  • -xtitle ([float]) – x position of title in Stokes plot

  • -max – Plot the maximum differences

  • -vertical – Plot the last plot vertical

  • -v – Print out tables with values at different log taus.

  • executed. (There are optional options which change the plots. Additional parameters given as an argument when the script is) –

Return type:

None

Compares two simulations by computing and plotting the chi2 value as well as computing the mean value.

plots.analysis_compare_chi2.analysis_compare_chi2(conf1, conf2)[source]#

Compares the chi2 of two simulations for different physical parameters.

Parameters:

  • conf1 (dict) – Configuration for simulation 1

  • conf2 (dict) – Configuration for simulation 2

  • executed. (Additional parameters given as an argument when the script is) –

  • [str] (-add2) – Additional save path. Default: ‘./’

  • optional – Additional save path. Default: ‘./’

  • [str] – Additional text in filenames

  • [str] – Add label text

  • -T – Plot temperature in K

  • -B – Plot magentic field strength in Gauss

  • -vlos – Plot line of sight velocity in cm/s

  • -inc – Plot inclination by subtracting in deg

  • -azi – Plot azimuth by adding in deg

  • [str] – Additional text in label for model 1

  • [str] – Additional text in label for model 2

Return type:

None

Analyses the quality of multiple Monte Carlo Simulations

plots.analysis_multiple.analysis_multiple(confs, labels)[source]#

Analysis multiple simulations and puts it in one plot

Parameters:

  • confs (list) – List of dictionaries with the configs

  • labels (list) – List of strings with the labels for each plot

  • executed. (There are optional options which change the plots. Additional parameters given as an argument when the script is) –

  • [str] (-title) – Additional save path. Default ‘./’

  • optional – Additional save path. Default ‘./’

  • [str] – Additional text in filenames

  • -T – Compare temperature in K

  • -B – Compare magentic field strength in Gauss

  • -vlos – Compare line of sight velocity in km/s

  • -inc – Compare inclination by subtracting in deg

  • -azi – Compare azimuth by adding in deg

  • [str] – Title of the 4 figures plot

  • [float] (-xtitle) – x position of title in Stokes plot

  • -limitT – Set y limits in T as ‘ymin,ymax’

  • -vertical – Plot the last plot vertical

  • -v – print out tables with values at different log taus.

Return type:

None

Notes

Note: B, vlos, inc and T is always compared but not plotted alone if the flags are not used.

Plots the result of the SIR inversion

plots.Ic_test.Ic_test(conf, num)[source]#

Plots Ic fit vs I obs in a plot. It uses the first element in the wavelength range as continuum

Parameters:

  • config (dict) – Dict. with all the information from the config

  • num (int) – determines which range is used (1 = 1st line in grid, etc.)

  • executed. (Additional parameters given as an argument when the script is) –

  • [str] (-title) – Rel. path to the spectral veil corrected data if standard labelling is not used.

  • [str] – Rel. path to the Stokes result if standard labelling is not used.

  • [str] – Additional save path. Default ‘./’.

  • optional – Additional save path. Default ‘./’.

  • [str] – Additional text in filenames.

  • [str] – Title in plot.

  • [int] (-num) – Determines which range is used (1 = 1st line in grid, etc.) if not the first one is wanted.

Return type:

None

Plots the result of the SIR inversion

plots.result.result_1C(conf, wave, tau, waveV=-1)[source]#

Plots the result of the inversion 1C

Parameters:

  • config (dict) – Dict. with all the information from the config

  • wave (float) – Wavelength in A where the Stokes vector is plottet

  • tau (float) – log tau value where the model is plotted

  • waveV (float, optional) – Wavelength for Stokes V in A (-1 not used), Default: -1

  • executed. (Additional parameters given as an argument when the script is) –

  • [str] (-title3) – Rel. path to the spectral veil corrected data if standard labelling is not used, optional.

  • [str] – Rel. path to the Stokes result if standard labelling is not used, optional.

  • [str] – Rel. path to the Models of the inversion if standard labelling is not used.

  • -errors – Rel. path to the Errors of the inversion if standard labelling is not used.

  • -chi – Rel. path to the chi2 file of the inversion if standard labelling is not used.

  • [str] – Additional save path. Default ‘./’.

  • optional – Additional save path. Default ‘./’.

  • [str] – Additional text in filenames

  • [str] – Add label text

  • [str] – Title in Result Stokes plot

  • [str] – Title in Obs. Stokes plot

  • [str] – Title in Model 1 plot

  • [float] (-logI) – Changing the x position of the title

  • -T – Plot temperature in K

  • -Pe – Plot electron pressure in dyn/cm^2

  • -vmicro – Plot microturbulence in cm/s

  • -B – Plot magentic field strength in Gauss

  • -vlos – Plot line of sight velocity in km/s

  • -gamma – Plot inclination by subtracting in deg

  • -phi – Plot azimuth by adding in deg

  • -z – Plot real height in km

  • -Pg – Plot gas pressure in dyn/cm^2

  • -rho – Plot density

  • -vertical – Plot spectra vertically

  • -chi2 – Plot chi2

  • -plot_chi2 – Plot chi2 in the 4 subplots plot

  • [float] – Plot Stokes Q in another wavelength position in A

  • [float] – Plot Stokes U in another wavelength position in A

  • [float] – Plot Stokes V in another wavelength position in A

  • [float] – Plot Temperature at this log tau.

  • [float] – Plot Magnetic Field at this log tau.

  • [float] – Plot LoS Velocity at this log tau.

  • [float] – Plot Inclination at this log tau.

  • [float (-limitI) – Limit in the x and y plot as a list xmin,xmax,ymin,xmax

  • float – Limit in the x and y plot as a list xmin,xmax,ymin,xmax

  • float – Limit in the x and y plot as a list xmin,xmax,ymin,xmax

  • float] – Limit in the x and y plot as a list xmin,xmax,ymin,xmax

  • [float – Set the limit for the colorbar in the temperature.

  • float] – Set the limit for the colorbar in the temperature.

  • [float – Set the limit for the colorbar in the magnetic field.

  • float] – Set the limit for the colorbar in the magnetic field.

  • [float – Set the limit for the colorbar in chi2.

  • float] – Set the limit for the colorbar in chi2.

  • [float – Set the limit for the colorbar in Stokes I.

  • float] – Set the limit for the colorbar in Stokes I.

  • -arc – Print x and y axis in arcseconds

  • -flipx – Mirror/Flip data as sometimes it is wrong in GRIS with the location on the sun

Return type:

None

plots.result.result_2C(conf, wave, tau, Type='_1', plot_stokes=True)[source]#

Plots the result of the inversion for 2C

Parameters:

  • conf (dict) – Dict. with all the information from the config

  • wave (float) – Wavelength in A where the Stokes vector is plottet

  • tau (float) – log tau value where the model is plotted

  • Type (string, optional) – prefix for determining which model is used. Default: ‘_1’

  • plot_stokes (bool, optional) – Plot the stokes vector. Default: True

  • executed. (Additional parameters given as an argument when the script is) –

  • [str] (-title4) – Rel. path to the spectral veil corrected data if standard labelling is not used, optional.

  • [str] – Rel. path to the Stokes result if standard labelling is not used, optional.

  • [str] – Rel. path to the Models 1 of the inversion if standard labelling is not used.

  • [str] – Rel. path to the Models 2 of the inversion if standard labelling is not used.

  • -errors – Rel. path to the Errors of the inversion if standard labelling is not used.

  • -chi – Rel. path to the chi2 file of the inversion if standard labelling is not used.

  • [str] – Additional save path. Default ‘./’.

  • optional – Additional save path. Default ‘./’.

  • [str] – Additional text in filenames

  • [str] – Add label text

  • [str] – Title in Result Stokes plot

  • [str] – Title in Obs. Stokes plot

  • [str] – Title in Model 1 plot

  • [str] – Title in Model 2 plot with 4 plots

  • [float] (-logI) – Changing the x position of the title

  • -T – Plot temperature in K

  • -Pe – Plot electron pressure in dyn/cm^2

  • -vmicro – Plot microturbulence in cm/s

  • -B – Plot magentic field strength in Gauss

  • -vlos – Plot line of sight velocity in km/s

  • -gamma – Plot inclination by subtracting in deg

  • -phi – Plot azimuth by adding in deg

  • -z – Plot real height in km

  • -Pg – Plot gas pressure in dyn/cm^2

  • -rho – Plot density

  • -vertical – Plot spectra vertically

  • -chi2 – Plot chi2

  • -fill – Plot the filling factor

  • -plot_chi2 – Plot chi2 in the 4 subplots plot

  • -plot_fill – Plot filling factor in the 4 subplots plot

  • [float] – Plot Stokes Q in another wavelength position in A

  • [float] – Plot Stokes U in another wavelength position in A

  • [float] – Plot Stokes V in another wavelength position in A

  • [float] – Plot Temperature at this log tau.

  • [float] – Plot Magnetic Field at this log tau.

  • [float] – Plot LoS Velocity at this log tau.

  • [float] – Plot Inclination at this log tau.

  • [float (-limitI) – Limit in the x and y plot as a list xmin,xmax,ymin,xmax

  • float – Limit in the x and y plot as a list xmin,xmax,ymin,xmax

  • float – Limit in the x and y plot as a list xmin,xmax,ymin,xmax

  • float] – Limit in the x and y plot as a list xmin,xmax,ymin,xmax

  • [float – Set the limit for the colorbar in the temperature.

  • float] – Set the limit for the colorbar in the temperature.

  • [float – Set the limit for the colorbar in the magnetic field.

  • float] – Set the limit for the colorbar in the magnetic field.

  • [float – Set the limit for the colorbar in chi2.

  • float] – Set the limit for the colorbar in chi2.

  • [float – Set the limit for the colorbar in Stokes I.

  • float] – Set the limit for the colorbar in Stokes I.

  • -arc – Print x and y axis in arcseconds

  • -flipx – Mirror/Flip data as sometimes it is wrong in GRIS with the location on the sun

Return type:

None

plots.visualizer.visualizer_1C(conf, wave)[source]#

Plots the Stokes vector with obs. and fits and the model depending on which pixel is clicked on in the appearing figure.

Parameters:

  • config (dict) – All the information from the config file

  • wave (float) – Wavelength in A where the Stokes Map is plotted / Or tau when model is plotted in the map

  • executed. (Additional parameters given as an argument when the script is) –

  • [str] (-title) – Rel. path to the spectral veil corrected data if standard labelling is not used.

  • [str] – “Rel. path to the Stokes result if standard labelling is not used.

  • [str] – Rel. path to the Models of the inversion if standard labelling is not used.

  • [str] – Rel. path to the chi2 file of the inversion if standard labelling is not used.

  • [str] – Additional save path. Default: ‘./’

  • optional – Additional save path. Default: ‘./’

  • [str] – Additional text in filenames

  • [str] – Add label text

  • [str] – Title in Stokes plot

  • -T – Plot temperature in K

  • -Pe – Plot electron pressure in dyn/cm^2

  • -vmicro – Plot microturbulence in cm/s

  • -B – Plot magentic field strength in Gauss

  • -vlos – Plot line of sight velocity in km/s

  • -inc – Plot inclination in deg

  • -azi – Plot azimuth in deg

  • -z – Plot real height in km

  • -Pg – Plot gas pressure in dyn/cm^2

  • -rho – Plot density

  • -vertical – Plot spectra vertically

  • -chi2 – Plot chi2

Return type:

None

plots.visualizer.visualizer_2C(conf, wave)[source]#

Plots the Stokes vector with obs. and fits and the model depending on which pixel is clicked on in the appearing figure.

Parameters:

  • conf (dict) – All the information from the config file

  • wave (float) – Wavelength in A where the Stokes Map is plotted / Or tau when model is plotted in the map

  • executed. (Additional parameters given as an argument when the script is) –

  • [str] (-title) – Rel. path to the spectral veil corrected data if standard labelling is not used.

  • [str] – “Rel. path to the Stokes result if standard labelling is not used.

  • [str] – Rel. path to the Models of the inversion if standard labelling is not used.

  • [str] – Rel. path to the chi2 file of the inversion if standard labelling is not used.

  • [str] – Additional save path (optional, default ‘./’)

  • [str] – Additional text in filenames

  • [str] – Add label text

  • [str] – Title in Stokes plot

  • -T – Plot temperature in K

  • -Pe – Plot electron pressure in dyn/cm^2

  • -vmicro – Plot microturbulence in cm/s

  • -B – Plot magentic field strength in Gauss

  • -vlos – Plot line of sight velocity in km/s

  • -inc – Plot inclination in deg

  • -azi – Plot azimuth in deg

  • -z – Plot real height in km

  • -Pg – Plot gas pressure in dyn/cm^2

  • -rho – Plot density

  • -vertical – Plot spectra vertically

  • -chi2 – Plot chi2

Return type:

None
